content: sts round 9 *fpdc around next 7 sts half_double_crochet in next st* repeat between ** until end of round repeat round 9 eight more times for a total of 17 rounds round 18 *fpdc2tog double_crochet in next 3 sts fpdc2tog half_double_crochet* repeat between ** until end of round 48 sts round 19 *fpdc2tog double_crochet fpdc2tog half_double_crochet* repeat between ** until end of round 32 sts round 20 *half_double_crochet in next 3 sts single_crochet in next st* repeat between ** until end of round optional round 21 *decrease single_crochet in next 2 sts* repeat between ** until end of round 24 sts note this is optional because i did not originally do this but found that the top hole was slightly too large for my liking continue to finishing instructions finishing the pumpkin cut a long tail approx 12 -16 depending on size with tapestry needle weave the tail under into the front loops of the stitches in the last row until you ve woven the tail through all stitches stuff the pumpkin with your preferred choice of stuffing you can also add your choice of stem here as well personally i used a bunch of yarn scraps/tails and sticks for stems pull the tail to tighten and close up the pumpkin adding more stuffing if needed shaping the pumpkin insert your needle into the top hole of the pumpkin pushing it through all the way to the bottom side of the pumpkin through the hole from the magic_ring pull tail tightly to deepen the top center of the pumpkin © 2018 jessica barril | page 4 of 5 pull yarn tail around to the top hole of the pumpkin and insert needle again making sure that the tail lines up with one of the 8 columns of recessed stitches pull tightly repeat seven more times insert needle into bottom of the pumpkin through the stuffing to secure the tail cut yarn and you re done © 2018 jessica barril | page 5 of 5
